title: Protect yourself and others | Coronavirus Victoria
description: Stay well with these 6 simple steps to protect yourself and others.
cleaned_text: Stay ahead of COVID-19 with 6 simple steps As we live with COVID-19, we can continue to protect ourselves, our loved ones and at-risk Victorians. Follow these 6 simple steps to help prevent severe illness and reduce the spread of the virus in our community. [ ](https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/get-vaccinated) Get vaccinated Information on how to book your third dose or fourth dose with your GP or pharmacist now. [ ](https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/ventilation) Let fresh air in You are less likely to catch COVID-19 in places that are well ventilated. Good ventilation comes from opening windows and doors, using fans and air purifiers. [ ](https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/recovery) Managing COVID-19 at home Information on getting the right help for your recovery, and getting support to match your COVID-19 symptoms [ ](https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/testing) Get tested if unwell Get tested as soon as you notice any symptoms and isolate for at least 5 days and up to 7 days (depending on your symptoms) if you are COVID-19 positive. [ ](https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/covid-19-medicines) Get medicines if at risk Victorians who are at higher risk of severe illness from COVID-19 may be eligible for medicines that reduce severe illness. Plan ahead and discuss options with your doctor. Look after yourself [ ](/information-for-seniors-covid-19) COVID-19 advice for seniors Being prepared is the best way to reduce your risk from COVID-19, including making a plan to access antivirals. [ ](/information-travellers) COVID-19 information for travellers Find out about travelling to and from Victoria, including both interstate and international advice. [ ](/mental-health-support) Mental health support Find information on mental health help and support available to all Victorians Reviewed 04 September 2023
